Package game

Class GamePlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
      • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Player
        • game.GamePlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Printable, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Skilled, java.lang.Comparable<edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor>
    public class GamePlayer
extends edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Player
    Represents a player in the game. GamePlayer has additional MaxCounter attribute and stunnedPlayer boolean variable. These additional instance variables enables GamePlayer to be stunned by Ninja.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • playTurn

        public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action playTurn​(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actions actions,
                                                 edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map,
                                                 edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Display display)
        Plays a turn and display the actions that can be performed by the player. If the player is stunned. This overridden method; 1. Increments the counter if the player is stunned and the counter can be incremented. If the counter can be incremented, it indicates that the player has not been stunned for two turns. Hence,it adds a newly instantiated SkipTurnAction into the newly instantiated Actions as the player is not allowed to perform any other actions. 2. Once the counter reaches its maximum value, it cannot be incremented anymore and the counter will reset in the MaxCounter class. It sets the boolean stunnedPlayer to false to return the state that the player is no longer stunned. If the player is not stunned, calls its superclass's playTurn method to play a turn and display the actions that can be performed by the player.
        Overrides:
        playTurn in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Player
        Parameters:
        actions - the actions to display
        map - the map to display
        display - the object that performs the console I/O
        Returns:
        The Action that the user selects if the player is not stunned. The SkipTurnAction if the player is stunned.

      • setPlayerStunned

        protected void setPlayerStunned​(boolean stunStatus)
        To change the boolean indicating if the player is stunned. Changes the boolean attribute, stunnedPlayer.
        Parameters:
        stunStatus - The new status to update the stunnedPlayer boolean to.

      • getPlayerStunned

        protected boolean getPlayerStunned()
        Returns the status if the player is stunned. Returns the boolean stunnedPlayer.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the player is stunned.
